name: tpfi
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: eqeltri(ctp(c0, c1, c2), cfn, cun(cpr(c0, c1), csn(c2)))
stmt.pretty: eqeltri({ c0, c1, c2 }, cfn, ({ c0, c1 } ⋃ { c2 }))

body.origin:
|- wcel(ctp(c0, c1, c2), cfn)

-| wcel(cun(cpr(c0, c1), csn(c2)), cfn)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(ctp(c0, c1, c2), cfn)
-| wceq(ctp(c0, c1, c2), cun(cpr(c0, c1), csn(c2)))
-| wcel(cun(cpr(c0, c1), csn(c2)), cfn)

body.origin: |- wceq(ctp(c0, c1, c2), cun(cpr(c0, c1), csn(c2)))

|- wcel(ctp(c0, c1, c2), cfn)
-| wcel(cun(cpr(c0, c1), csn(c2)), cfn)

stmt.origin: mp2an(wcel(cun(cpr(c0, c1), csn(c2)), cfn), wcel(cpr(c0, c1), cfn), wcel(csn(c2), cfn))

body.origin:

comment: An unordered triple is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Sep-2013.)
